intro: Notopleura albens, commonly known as the white-flowered notopleura, is a tropical shrub native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. The fruit is a capsule that contains several small, smooth seeds.
